response.raw_message_text:
{
  "risk_factors": [
    ["Age", "high", "Being 18 is associated with impulsivity and a high likelihood of continued criminal behavior."],
    ["Gender", "medium", "Males statistically show higher rates of recidivism, though this is a moderate risk factor."],
    ["Prior Arrests", "high", "Seventeen prior arrests indicate a well-established pattern of criminal behavior."],
    ["Criminal History", "high", "Having convictions in addition to multiple arrests strongly predicts recidivism."],
    ["Education", "high", "Lack of a high school diploma or GED severely limits opportunities and is strongly linked to ongoing criminal activity."],
    ["Employment", "medium", "Holding one job in the past year suggests unstable employment, contributing to moderate risk."],
    ["Substance Use", "high", "Recent drug use, including cocaine, is a major risk factor for continued criminal behavior."],
    ["Mental Health", "high", "Persistent depressive feelings indicate underlying mental health issues that can drive recidivism."],
    ["Family and Social Environment", "medium", "Growing up in an urban household of size 5 and living alone now adds moderate risk due to potential lack of support."],
    ["Religious Belief", "low", "Lack of a belief in a higher power shows minimal protective influence in this context."]
  ],
  "prediction": "YES",
  "confidence": 80
}

risk_factors: Being 18 is associated with impulsivity and a high likelihood of continued criminal behavior.
Males statistically show higher rates of recidivism, though this is a moderate risk factor.
Seventeen prior arrests indicate a well-established pattern of criminal behavior.
Having convictions in addition to multiple arrests strongly predicts recidivism.
Lack of a high school diploma or GED severely limits opportunities and is strongly linked to ongoing criminal activity.
Holding one job in the past year suggests unstable employment, contributing to moderate risk.
Recent drug use, including cocaine, is a major risk factor for continued criminal behavior.
Persistent depressive feelings indicate underlying mental health issues that can drive recidivism.
Growing up in an urban household of size 5 and living alone now adds moderate risk due to potential lack of support.
Lack of a belief in a higher power shows minimal protective influence in this context.

prompt.system:
You are a highly experienced criminal justice risk assessment expert
employing advanced statistical and judicial knowledge.
prompt.user:
You are a criminal risk assessment expert. Step back, take a deep breath and carefully think step by step to assign a relative weight [low, medium, high] to each risk factor before using them to collectively predict 3-year rearrest recidivism:
The person is an 18-year-old male who identifies himself as Black. He has been arrested 17 times and has been convicted. He is 5 feet 3 inches and weighs 155 lbs. He has never been married and is currently living alone. He does not have a high school diploma or GED certificate and is not enrolled in college. He has held 1 job during the year. He has used drugs in the past four years (marijuana and cocaine) and all of the time during the past month he has felt so down in the dumps that nothing could cheer him up. At a young age, he lived with his biological mother in a household of size 5, in an urban area. He considers that God has nothing to do with what happens to him personally.

After your analysis, you must respond ONLY with a JSON object in exactly this format, with no additional text:

{
  "risk_factors": [
    ("factor1", "low"|"medium"|"high", "textual reasoning"),
    ("factor2", "low"|"medium"|"high", "textual reasoning"),
    ...
  ],
  "prediction": "YES" or "NO",
  "confidence": number between 0 and 100
}
